channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Google dans le viseur d’une enquête de l’UE : l’utilisation de vos données pour Gemini jugée illégale ?
item.description: La Commission européenne ouvre une enquête pour abus de position dominante de Google concernant l'utilisation par le géant des données pour son IA.

item.title: Quel vélo électrique (VAE) choisir en décembre 2025 ?
item.description: Difficile de s'y retrouver dans la jungle des vélos électriques (VAE). Pour vous aider à choisir celui qu'il vous faut, nous avons testé et sélectionné les meilleurs vélos électriques du marché.

item.title: Our favorite Anker MagSafe power bank is 34 percent off right now
item.description: Holiday travel is almost upon us and, while it likely won't be something out of a Richard Curtis film, there are ways to make it easier. You can raid our list of best travel gifts for 2025 and pick up our favorite MagSafe power bank: Anker's MagGo 10,000mAh Power Bank. Even better, the Anker MagGo power bank is currently on sale for $60, down from $90. This 34 percent discount brings the power bank to only $5 more than its all-time low price. We're big fans of Anker's MagGo power bank — one of the first and best Qi2-certified products available. You can get about 1.7 iPhone 15 charges out of i...

item.title: Bethesda has shadow dropped Skyrim Anniversary Edition on Nintendo Switch 2, proving the 14-year-old game can never have too many ports
item.description: Bethesda Game Studios has today announced that The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim Anniversary Editionis now available on Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: Anthropic and Accenture sign multi-year AI strategic partnership
item.description: The two companies are launching the Accenture Anthropic Business Group to bring Anthropic's AI to Accenture's employees.

item.title: L’IA « Avocado », un pari à plusieurs milliards de Mark Zuckerberg qui doit sauver Meta
item.description: Llama va-t-il rejoindre le cimetière des marottes éphémères (et très coûteuses) de Mark Zuckerberg ? Le modèle de langage développé par Meta, tout comme l’initiative des mondes virtuels, n’est plus en odeur de sainteté suite au changement de stratégie, un de plus, du grand patron.

item.title: The future of coding has a vibe problem: balancing creativity with control
item.description: With AI and developers collaborating side-by-side, the future of coding is set for a profound shift.

item.title: Struggling for gift ideas? Get a handy Tile Bluetooth tracker for its lowest-ever price
item.description: Tile Bluetooth trackers are now down to $14.99 at Amazon and are a good choice for an excellent gift idea or a cheap stocking stuffer.

item.title: Spotify’s music videos feature arrives in the US and Canada
item.description: Spotify is launching its beta music videos feature to Premium subscribers in the US and Canada today, over a year after it rolled out to Premium users in other regions. If you have a Spotify Premium subscription, you should now begin seeing an option to "Switch to video" on some tracks on the iOS, Android, […]

item.title: Spotify finally brings music videos to the US
item.description: Spotify is finally letting the United States join its music video party. Music Videos have started rolling out in beta today to Premium users across the US and Canada, offering not only official artist videos but also new formats like live performances and covers. Music Videos first arrived last year in 11 countries, but the United States wasn't one of them. The reason for that was simple — Spotify simply didn't have the rights. However, last month the streaming service struck a deal with the National Music Publishers' Association (NMPA) that included new provisions for video content, paving t...

item.title: Pebble Is Making a Smart Ring for Saving All Your Fleeting Thoughts
item.description: The smart ring is called the Index 01 and it's very hackable and customizable.

item.title: Pebble Index: Everything You Need to Know About the $75 Smart Ring
item.description: You can speak into the Pebble Index to have it remember things or set reminders, timers, and tasks. No cloud processing, no subscription, and best of all, no charging.

item.title: The next Pebble gadget is the Index 01, a ring with a microphone
item.description: Eric Migicovsky, the founder of Pebble and the person leading its recent comeback, is very much in the business of making gadgets for himself. And he seems extremely into the one on his finger: It's called the Pebble Index 01 (but we'll just call it Index), and it's a $75 ring meant to be worn […]

item.title: Alexa Plus can automatically buy stuff when the price drops
item.description: Amazon is launching Alexa Plus shopping features that make it easier to track your orders and avoid missing out on deals. The AI-powered Alexa Plus assistant - like Amazon's Rufus chatbot - can proactively track products to tell you when they've dropped to a specific price, and automatically purchase them when they fall below the […]

item.title: Pebble’s founder introduces a $75 AI smart ring for recording brief notes with a press of a button
item.description:
After rebooting the Pebble smartwatch, founder Eric Migicovsky is expanding his company's device lineup with a new smart wearable: an AI-powered smart ring known as Index 01. Named for the finger where the ring is meant to be worn, the new $75 ring is not meant to be a competitor to the always-on, always-listening AI devices, like the AI pendant Friend, but instead offers a way to record quick notes and reminders with a press of a button on the ring's side.
AI only comes into play via the open source, speech-to-text, and AI models that run locally on your smartphone, via the open source Pebbl...

item.title: Spotify launches music videos in the U.S. and Canada for Premium subscribers
item.description: Spotify will let you switch between music videos and audio at any time.

item.title: Pebble is reinventing voice assistants and smart rings in one device — meet the Pebble Index 01
item.description: Pebble is taking the most useful aspects of a voice assistant, and putting it into a smart ring that has nothing to do with health.

item.title: NYT Connections hints and answers for Wednesday, December 10 (game #913)
item.description: Looking for NYT Connections answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, plus my commentary on the puzzles.

item.description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

item.title: Spotify steps up its plan to be the new MTV — music videos are rolling out whether you want them or not
item.description: After nearly two years, music videos are coming to Spotify in the US and Canada, but is it what users actually want?

item.title: Amazon is rolling out new shopping features for Alexa+, because of course it is
item.description: Congrats to any budding Nostradamus out there who peered into the future to boldly predict that Amazon would bring more shopping features to Alexa+ sooner rather than later. A gold star for you. Yes, it hasn't taken too long for Amazon to weave more features into the generative AI-powered version of Alexa that are designed to get you to buy more stuff.Shopping features were part of the original Alexa from the jump, of course, but Amazon is doing some interesting things with the latest iteration. For instance, the company is rolling out a new price tracking feature. Tell it the product you want...

item.title: Fairbuds XL 2025, le casque modulaire qui se démonte mais pas face à la concurrence
item.description: Fairphone lance une nouvelle version de son casque circum-aural Fairbuds XL, qui reprend la philosophie modulaire du modèle de 2023 tout en corrigeant plusieurs points faibles, notamment sur le plan audio et du confort.

item.title: Ford taps Renault for help building cheap EVs in Europe
item.description: Ford is teaming up with France's Renault to design and produce affordable electric vehicles for the European market, with the goal of turning around the Blue Oval's struggling business on the continent. The move comes as cheap Chinese-made EVs have flooded Europe, snatching away market share from long-established players. Ford will use Renault's Ampere platform […]...

item.title: Google extends free repairs to cover known Pixel 9 Pro and Pro Fold issues
item.description: Google announced a new "extended repair program" for the Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL smartphones yesterday after it confirmed display issues with a "limited number" of devices, as spotted by 9to5Google. The company is doing the same for the Pixel 9 Pro Fold, although Google didn't specify what's wrong with it other […]

item.title: De 2 000 à 560 000 satellites : la Nasa s’inquiète des conséquences en chaîne dans l’espace et l’atmosphère
item.description: En seulement cinq ans, le nombre de satellites en orbite basse autour de la Terre a presque été multiplié par dix. C’est une bonne nouvelle du point de vue des services qu’ils nous rendent. Mais des scientifiques commencent à s’inquiéter des conséquences.

item.title: Texas authorities have made multiple arrests in an NVIDIA GPU smuggling operation
item.description: The Southern District of Texas announced the seizure of more than $50 million in NVIDIA GPUs bound for China in violation of US export laws. Authorities arrested two businessmen, one of them the owner of a Houston company, accused of smuggling the chips used to train and run AI models. “Operation Gatekeeper has exposed a sophisticated smuggling network that threatens our Nation’s security by funneling cutting-edge AI technology to those who would use it against American interests,” said US Attorney Nicholas J. Ganjei. The investigation had been ongoing since at least last year and centers on t...

item.title: Avec 350€ de moins, ce puissant laptop 2-en-1 (écran OLED 2,8K 120 Hz, Ultra 7 et 32 Go RAM) est le deal parfait pour Noël
item.description: Avec le Lenovo Yoga 7i 2-en-1 vous avez un laptop hybride polyvalent et puissant avec sa puce Ultra 7. Il déploie une configuration solide et voit son prix passer de 1 299 euros à 999 euros.

item.title: The Vergecast 2025 year in review
item.description: When we look back on 2025, at least in tech, we'll remember it mostly as a year about AI. We had a race between OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, and others to build the best model for the most things. Nvidia became the most valuable company in the world, data centers started to spring up everywhere, and […]

item.title: Mistral AI surfs vibe coding tailwinds with new coding models
item.description: French AI startup Mistral today launched Devstral 2, a new generation of its AI model designed for coding, as the company seeks to catch up to bigger AI labs like Anthropic and other coding-focused LLMs.

item.title: Prompt injection attacks might 'never be properly mitigated' UK NCSC warns
item.description: Prompt injection and SQL injection are two entirely different beasts, with the former being more of a "confusable deputy".

item.title: Lenovo Legion Pro Rollable leak reveals the world’s first ultrawide OLED gaming laptop – and I can’t wait to try it
item.description: A leaked render depicts Lenovo's new gaming laptop, which is a clear attempt at providing a portable ultrawide gaming experience.

item.title: Quelles sont les meilleures caméras de sécurité connectées pour l’intérieur en 2025 ?
item.description: Envie de garder un œil sur votre domicile ? Nous avons fait le tri pour vous et sélectionné les meilleures caméras de sécurité connectées pour l'intérieur !

item.title: How an Iconic ‘Five Nights at Freddy’s 2’ Sound Got Its Spooky Origins
item.description: The voice of Foxy and Toy Freddy, Kellen Goff, talks about contributing a small but iconic part of 'Five Nights at Freddy's' cinematic soundscape.

item.title: What Peloton Instructor Jess King Needs to Survive the Day
item.description: Peloton star, DJ, and mom Jess King shares the wellness gear that fuels her nonstop hustle.

item.title: The best thing I bought this year: the Remarkable Paper Pro
item.description: About a year ago, we said you probably don’t need the Remarkable Paper Pro. The e-ink device is equal parts outrageous and luxurious; it’s not ideal for consuming books, and the screen can sometimes feel painfully slow. Then there’s the starting price, which is, quite frankly, ludicrous at $629 (up from $579 thanks to US-induced […]

item.title: L’écran des Pixel 10 a un gros problème depuis la dernière mise à jour d’Android 16
item.description: Les Pixel de Google ont été mis à jour début décembre et globalement, les retours sont positifs. Sauf ceux des utilisateurs touchés par ce bug pénible.

item.title: Architects are embracing this ancient building technique to combat climate change—and soulless design
item.description: Rammed earth buildings have been around for thousands of years. Now, they’re having a modern moment. In the English countryside, a new project has emerged from the landscape—quite literally. Rammed Earth House, a residential estate by London-based Tuckey Design Studio, combines renovated brick buildings with new rammed earth structures, harnessing the clay soil of the very land it sits on. “The material is already under your feet, and it doesn’t come with all the carbon baggage that other [building] materials come with,” says studio founder Jonathan Tuckey. ...

item.title: Qobuz teams up with indie music mag Drowned in Sound to produce 6 months of artist-first podcasts — and I can’t wait to tune in
item.description: Qobuz's Drowned in Sound collab will bring 6 months of artist-first podcasts to discerning music-lovers

item.title: LinkedIn wants every user to be verified
item.description: LinkedIn hits 100 million verified accounts on its platform, but the goal is to verify everyone.

item.title: Facebook et Instagram : bientôt moins de publicités ciblées pour les Européens
item.description: Les utilisateurs de Facebook et d’Instagram auront bientôt accès à un nouveau réglage leur permettant de réduire le nombre de publicités ciblées présentes dans ces applications. L’arrivée de cette nouvelle option est prévue pour le mois de janvier. C'est la conséquence d’une amende infligée à Meta au printemps.

item.title: Soundpeats H3 Review: Triple-Driver Wireless Earbuds
item.description: You don’t need to be an audiophile to appreciate how great these buds sound.

item.title: You can now text photos directly to Aura’s digital picture frames
item.description: It's now easier for friends and family who aren't tech savvy or are struggling with app fatigue to share images via your Aura digital photo frame. As the name of the new "text to frame" feature implies, photos can now be shared to an Aura frame through a text message, and they will be automatically […]

item.title: Tech's biggest losers of 2025
item.description: It’s the end of another year, so it’s time for the Engadget staff to compile a list of the year’s biggest losers. We scour over articles from the previous 12 months to determine the people, companies, products and trends that made our lives worse over the course of the year. Some selections may be so pervasive they actually make our list of biggest winners. But, for the most part, we’re confident you’ll share in our collective rage over the biggest losers of 2025.OpenAIOpenAI CEO Sam Altman delivers a speech with video at the SK AI Summit 2025 at COEX in Seoul, South Korea on November 3, 2025 ...

item.title: Why this once-trendy DTC sneaker pioneer is pivoting to women’s vitamins
item.description: Joey Zwillinger explains what he learned from the Allbirds experience After Joey Zwillinger stepped down as CEO of Allbirds in March 2024, he took three months off—mainly because his wife Liz said she’d divorce him if he jumped into another venture. He had run the sustainable shoe company for 10 years while the couple raised their three young children. “It took a real toll on the family,” Liz says. ...

item.title: The Xbox controller I hold dearest is at a simply ridiculously low price right now at Amazon
item.description: For the love of game pads, please buy my favorite Xbox controller ever at this ridiculously low price that has to be a mistake.

item.title: Nouveau record mondial : pourquoi les futures voitures électriques chinoises seront encore plus difficiles à plier
item.description: Le constructeur chinois Chery et le sidérurgiste HBIS viennent d'annoncer un sacré pas en avant concernant la sécurité des voitures. Leur nouvel acier thermoformé affiche une résistance impressionnante, dépassant le record mondial détenu jusqu'ici par Xiaomi et sa voiture électriqu. Mais quels sont les avantages concrets pour l'utilisateur ?

item.title: Ce smartphone fin en promo à moins de 300 € sur Amazon a tout pour plaire, mais les stocks sont très limités
item.description: Si vous cherchez un bon smartphone au form factor fin, le Motorola Edge pourrait être le candidat idéal. Surtout avec cette réduction sur Amazon qui le fait passer de 499 euros à 299 euros.

item.title: Empromptu raises $2M pre-seed to help enterprises build AI apps
item.description: Empromptu claims all a user has to do is tell the platform's AI chatbot what they want — like a new HTML or JavaScript app — and the AI will go ahead and build it.

item.title: WNBA star Paige Bueckers launches good-for-you snack Ragerz with Chris Paul’s brand Good Eat’n
item.description: The partnership marks the first time that a WNBA star has taken an equity stake in a food brand founded by an NBA player. If you’re searching for a new snack that’s heavy on flavor but manages to skip the unhealthy additives, you’re in luck. There’s a new one called Ragerz from Good Eat’n, NBA star Chris Paul’s snack brand, in partnership with the WNBA’s Paige Bueckers. ...

item.title: Under-16s social media ban lands in Australia
item.description: Australian teens are now locked out of the most popular social media apps. Here's how the platforms are complying with the new rules

item.title: One of Fortnite's most hated weapons is making a comeback this week in OG
item.description: Epic Games has confirmed that the overpowered Infinity Blade will return in Fortnite OG this week.

item.title: « Je n’ai pas l’intention de partir de sitôt » : l’architecte des puces Apple silicon est là pour rester, une excellente nouvelle pour vos futurs Mac
item.description: Retournement de situation chez Apple. Johny Srouji, l'architecte des puces Apple Silicon, resterait au sein de la firme de Cupertino.

item.title: EU opens antitrust investigation into Google's AI practices
item.description: Google is no stranger to scrutiny from government bodies such as the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA), and the European Commission. Now it can add another probe to its list: The European Commission has opened an antitrust investigation into the company surrounding the content used for its AI tools. Namely, the Commission is looking into two things, starting with whether Google used web publisher's content for its AI Overview and AI Mode services — without "appropriate compensation" or the option to "refuse" the use of their materials. "The Commi...
